file_content.text: Teesix = erased memory core + restarting systems // You = friend?
Organic beings = returned + successful // Master = standing by + excited
Organic life-form = returned + successful // Master = eager to communicate
Thank goodness you're alive. According to the droid, your mission was a complete success. POWs are escaping to Republic transports.
Plus there was a major attack on an Imperial-owned superstructure. Massive damage. Hundreds of fatalities--maybe thousands. Know anything about it?
An agent took those explosives you sent. Carried out the bombing. It was time to send the Empire a message.
It was all part of the plan.
Those explosives were meant to help with the prison break. That wasn't a message, it was mass-murder!
What is this place doing to us? I just killed a man and framed someone else for it.
Is this really how we're going to win the war?
They're waiting to give you a hero's welcome back at the spaceport. Don't worry, I won't tell them the truth.
The Empire has plenty of enemies. It sounds like one of them got proactive.
[Lie] Just a random bombing.
That's the strange thing. No one's claimed responsibility. Who would want to? So much killing today....
You've won the war for Nar Shaddaa. Forced the Empire to fall back. They're not used to retreating.
They'll be doing a lot of that, from now on.
They'd better get used to it.
Won't that be something to see? It'd almost make the cost of winning bearable.
What's your status? Are you alright?
Where are you? What happened?
Eventually, they'll have no place to fall back to--and then we finish them.
Next time, they die.
I'd accept unconditional surrender. There's been enough killing.
I took care of my superior. The agent I framed for it tried to run, and they killed her. No loose ends. I'm clear.
I'm about to board a shuttle for Coruscant. Think I got out of Imperial Intelligence just in time. Thanks for convincing me to leave.
You should report back to the spaceport. Let them know we won. It's been an honor. Logging off....
New command received = erase all datalogs // You = free to go + farewell!
Teesix = awaiting new commands // You = help Republic allies
Organic beings = match master's profile data + arrive within schedule parameters // Signaling Republic operative = now
Organic life-form = matches master's profile data + arrives on schedule // Signaling Republic operative = now
Lookie, lookie... fresh meat for the Shadow Town grinders. You too tough to chew? We'll see.
Sorry, threw away my manners when I went undercover. Weeks--months ago? Agent Valland. That's me. The people here are crazy, you know.
The Empire is preparing to execute Republic POWs. We need to free our people.
Our people are here, too.
Noble cause. Good way to die, as dying ways go.
You seem a little... not normal. Could I see some identification?
Are you also crazy?
Normal is as normal does. Down here, normal does a lot of strange things. Have to blend in. SIS training. I don't carry ID.
There's no time for your nonsense. We have a mission to complete.
Stop your babbling.
Right, mission. Always need one. I've got mine.
You brought the supply pack, right? Let's have a look. Ooh... detonite--and lots of it.
Did you know the Empire burned out SIS headquarters? Killed good agents. Friends... and more. One good burn deserves another.
I saw what happened to your friends--but you're talking about revenge, not rescue. Unless that detonite can save lives, it's useless.
We aren't here to bomb things.
That's easy. Killing Imperials will save lives.
I sense great pain and fear in you. Those feelings only lead to destruction.
Control your emotions.
Just where I want to go.
As long as we're burning through prison gates, I'm in.
Our mission is to free POWs.
I had something a little larger in mind.
I'm not sure you're in any condition to handle bombs. Maybe you should hand those back....
Let me keep the explosives.
You're funny. You'll blend right in down here.
How are you planning to burn the Empire? This is a prison, not a military base.
What's your target?
How did the Empire find our spy base, much less destroy it?
SIS headquarters is destroyed?
Don't know. All the people I could ask are dead. Doesn't matter. Blood calls out for blood.
The Empire needs to learn this is our galaxy. If they take out one of our bases, we burn down ten of theirs.
That's always been my policy.
Ambitious. I like it. On the other hand, there's a lot to be said for blowing up one big thing....
The Empire bought a superstructure from the Hutts. Nice place. Put all kinds of important people inside. Leaders. But this building has weak spots.
Figure this is enough detonite to gut the insides before they catch me. Go out with a bang.
That's our enemy's tactic, not to mention suicide. Pull yourself together--our people are in terrible danger.
You'll do no such thing!
Take those charges and create a diversion. Keep Imperial security forces busy so we can free the POWs and cover their escape.
Can tell you haven't been here long. Still an idealist.
Fine, we play it your way. Set the Empire's tail on fire and let it chase itself. Could be fun.
There are other agents nearby. Optimists, like you. I'll signal you're here to help. Don't be a stranger....
Make your sacrifice count. Unless the enemy loses a thousand people, you're wasting effort.
Destroy them all.
Big building. It'll be full when I make my run.
Still a few friendlies left, trying to crack the prison open. Optimistic types. They need your help.
Don't tell anyone my mission. "Need to know," right? Be seeing you. Not really....
Master's command = fulfilled // Teesix = powering down + awaiting new command
You = go now + help Republic allies + return later
Prison annex = restricted to Imperial personnel // You = trespasser
